name: A fat boar lies by the fire. It belongs to the innkeeper.
It's best to dress up before entering. The guests are very particular about appearances.
Customers call it the "Greasy Brat"
A faint smell of feces hangs in the air. It doesn't seem to bother the guests.
The ceiling shows a night sky with a full moon. It is painted with great care.
The furniture is made of bones. It is surprisingly comfortable.
If you don't order in rhyme, you won't be served.
Under no circumstances should you blink while speaking to the innkeeper.
With every order you get a hard-boiled egg.
A jar filled with eyes sits on the mantelpiece. It is said to be a family heirloom.
Known for their long and beautiful party nights.
Here, really “everything” is used as an ingredient.
Rumor has it that the owner is the king's forgotten son.
A troll named "Andy" works here as a cook. They say he makes an excellent cake.
Known for his bar fights.
Rumor has it that one of the regular guests is a true gambling expert.
The house specialty is a roast that is flambéed in poison.
A magician's protective spell lies over the tavern. It is said to keep out evil spirits.
Rituals are often held in the basement.
Every third day there's a dance competition. The prize: free drinks.
Visitors with magical powers are not welcome.
Weapons must stay outside. They are stored in a large chest.
A giant tree grows through the tavern. Criminals are often hanged from it.
There is a taxidermy exhibition in the back room. It is said to be cursed.
A coven of witches often visits at midnight.
The tavern is filled with the soothing sound of the sea.
A talking skull is placed at a table. It speaks to guests who come alone.
